turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Protofeminism.
turn.1: What was the relationship between protofeminism and Witchcraft?
turn.2: Starting with the Malleus Maleficarum, Renaissance Europe saw the publication of numerous treatises on witches: their essence, their featurs, and ways to spot, prosecute and punish them.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: This helped to reinforce and perpetuate the view of women as morally corrupt sinners, and to keep in place the restrictions placed on them.
turn.5: What kind of restrictions were placed on them?
turn.6: Yet not everyone agreed with this negative view of women and the restrictions placed on them.
turn.8: Simone de Beauvoir states that "the first time we see a woman take up her pen in defense of her sex" was when Christine de Pizan wrote "Épître au Dieu d'Amour" (Epistle to the God of Love) and "The Book of the City of Ladies", at the turn of the 15th century.
turn.9: Did anyone else take up the pen?
turn.10: An early male advocate of women's superiority was Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa in "The Superior Excellence of Women Over Men".
turn.11: What other roles did women have in the Renaissance?
turn.12: Catherine of Aragon, the first official female ambassador in European history, commissioned a book by Juan Luis Vives arguing that women had a right to an education, and encouraged and popularized education for women in England in her time as Henry VIII's wife.
